content.description:
This has boomer movement!

Start on same start as '

Crown Jewel

'. From here, hit a gaston in a good pocket, and match your hands. Throw up to a juggy ledge. Move your right hand onto another ledge. From here, almost anything to top out works. There is a mean thumb cling, which can also be used an intense gaston. From there, climb an easy topout!
content.location:
Use the same start as '

Crown Jewel

'. Move out right and up.

content.description: Start on a left hand crimp (slightly sharp) and a good right hand sloper with your feet down low. From there, work your right hand into a good crimp by some green moss and your left hand into a dish-y sloper. You are still able to keep feet low. From here, set your feet up, and fire into the top. This has a difficult topout (it is easier if topped out from the right side while still trying to climb over middle bulge).
content.location:
From the big jug start of

Crown Jewel

, this is to the left.

content.description:
Use the same start as '

Crown Jewel

', and traverse to the left on some good ledges and pockets. Don't go straight up once you move over or the grade becomes V1. Instead, keep moving left until you reach the crimp (first move right hand crimp on

Knuckle Buster

). Use this crimp also for your left hand as you send up to the good ledge. Finish with an easy topout.
content.location:
Start on '

Crown Jewel

,' then just traverse the pockets to the left.

content.description: Start on a big jug with good foot holds, and move your left hand up to a smaller sharp pocket. Step up, and fire into a good ledge. From there, an finish with an easy topout (this is just a short highball problem, so it has a slight sketchy factor).
content.location: Start on the obvious jug in the middle of the face closest to Opal Loop Trail.
